availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frederick Selmar Gottschalk (Kenton County, Kentucky, master tinner)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, master tinner. Native of Prussia. Married to Hermina Wachs Gottschalk in Hamilton County, Ohio, on October 16, 1854. Father of Rudolph Gottschalk, Adelbert Gottschalk, Selena Gottschalk, Augusta Gottschalk, Hermina Gottschalk, and Emma Gottschalk. Master tinner in Kenton County in 1860. Employed William Wachs as a tinner in Kenton County in 1860. Tinner in Kenton County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 4, p. 691.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 4, p. 256B to 257A.
Ohio Marriages, Hamilton County Marriages, 1854-1855, Film #000344468, p. 98.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 6th Congressional District, Vol. 1, June and July 1863, p. 170, p. 344 of microfilm, (Accessed via ancestry.com on April 6, 2020).
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport â€“ Microfilm (before 1911), KDLA, Roll #7013568: Covington, Certificates 1-962 (1901), certificate #554, p. 578 of microfilm.
Find A Grave, "Frederick Selmar Gottschalk (1830-1898)," Memorial 33987591, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/33987591 (accessed April 6, 2020).
